etymology.description: Inverted 曰(曰) (yuē, "to speak") -> 亼(亼) with a horizontal stroke at the bottom -> depicts 'not to speak' or something in the mouth
etymology.interpretation: The character 今(jīn, "now") represents a transformation of 曰(曰) to symbolize 'not to speak' or perhaps something held in the mouth, related to concepts of quiet or containment, suggesting the present or stasis of 'now'.

examples.chinese: 从今以后(從今以後)，我会更加努力(我會更加努力)。
examples.pinyin: Cóng jīn yǐhòu, wǒ huì gèngjiā nǔlì.
examples.english: From now on, I will work even harder.

examples.chinese: 今晨阅读使我清醒(今晨閱讀使我清醒)。
examples.pinyin: Jīn chén yuèdú shǐ wǒ qīngxǐng.
examples.english: Reading this morning makes me alert.
